summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 7886, entitled "An Ordinance establishing the grades of the following streets and avenues, in the City of Seattle; Pine Street, from First Avenue to Fourth Avenue; Second Avenue, from Pike Street to Pine Street; and Third Avenue, form Pike Street to Pine Street; and providing for the improvement of said Pine Street, from First Avenue to Fourth Avenue; Second Avenue, from Pike Street to Pine Street; and Third Avenue, from Pike Street to Pine Street; by regrading the same to the grade herein established, and by residewalking and planking with four (4) inch plank, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said City, approved December 6, 1899.
